JobFullDesc: Job DescriptionAt Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.The Boeing Commercial Airplanes, Customer Support organization is currently seeking an Associate Avionics Service Engineer with broad knowledge of avionics system design and engineering principles to assist airline customers in the resolution of in-service technical problems and issues related Displays & Crew Alerting. This position will be located in Seal Beach, California.The primary responsibility in this role will be addressing and resolving in-service issues related to airplane e-Enabling and Maintenance Systems. In this role, you will also be tasked with: working directly with airline customers to analyze system issues, developing and performing tests to ensure system designs meet operational and functional requirements, and monitor supplier performance to ensure system integration and compliance with requirements. The position requires flexibility to address emergent issues and support important airline meetings off-hours. This position may also require an occasional off-shift work schedule to support the fleet operating 24/7/365.Job priorities will include monitoring potential in-service risks and issues, and managing appropriate mitigation plans to assure a successful entry into service.  Additional activities include verification of all related Customer Support products, including Aircraft Maintenance Manual (AMM) and Fault Isolation Manual (FIM), as well as develop and update Fleet Team Digest (FTD) articles, Service Letters (SL) Maintenance Tips (MT), and responding to operator Service Requests (SR) by using Boeing products including My Boeing Fleet (MBF), Maintenance Performance Toolbox, Airplane Health Management (AHM).As a Service Engineer, you will be working on resolving operator issue real-time, including general systems questions, short to medium term Displays & Crew Alerting problem resolution, long term issue description and proactive fleet guidance, to all the way through to working with operators to recover Airplane On Ground (AOG) situations. This can involve working over the phone to troubleshooting an airplane halfway around the world, to being on onsite at the operator to return a grounded airplane back to revenue service, all while utilizing the latest Boeing tools, technology, data analytics, and real time fleet monitoring dataYou will be an integral part of supporting all Boeing Commercial Airplane models in-service and under development, including programs such as 747, 767, 777, 787, 737NG, 737 MAX, 777X, and the next generation of commercial airplanes.All interested teammates are welcome to apply.Position Responsibilities:Provides technical, design and informational support for basic production, product support or in-service issues. Troubleshoots basic system problems consistent with operational protocols.Supports and/or creates and provides basic technical documentation (e.g. Fleet Team Digest articles, Service Letters,
